weather_report:
This afternoon in Downtown San Francisco, the sun casts an inviting warmth across the streets, creating a shimmering atmosphere reminiscent of early autumn days. As the afternoon unfolds, temperatures comfortably hover near 62, a gentle reminder that winter is still a soft whisper away. The sky stretches wide, a brilliant canvas of blue with barely a cloud to interrupt the clarity, while a light breeze dances through the city, carrying the salty tang of the bay.

As the evening settles in, expect a whimsical transition as dusk approaches. The forecast suggests a somewhat cooler drop to around 50 degrees, accompanied by delicate patches of clouds that will embrace the night sky. Although the fog isn’t making a significant presence, there may be slight hints of the marine layer wrapping softly around the Golden Gate. As twilight falls, the air will cool, inviting layers to your attire—perhaps a light sweater or a cozy jacket and comfortable shoes, perfect for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront. The serenity of the evening invites a quiet moment to enjoy local cafés or perhaps a casual gathering with friends to share stories as the lights of the city begin to twinkle against the darkening sky.
